LEPC: N C Reg Emer Planing Dist

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This facility complies with all regulations for the handling and storage of NH3 and it is our ploicy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occure, it is out policy to notify the Buffalo Center Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

This facility is a farmer owned cooperative.  We sell agricultural products to memebers and non-members.  We sell NH3 for the sole purpose of fertilization of farm ground.  This facility consists of two 30,000 gallon storage tanks which are plumbed together.

Our worst case senario would be the sudden relearse of both tanks at one time when they were filled to capacity.  According to EPA look-up tables, the distance to endpoint would be 4.4 miles with an approximate population of 1686 people. Since this facility is located in relatively close proximity to the town of Buffalo Center, provisions have been designed to notify all affected person.  An evacuation plan is in place.

Our alternate senerio would to the accidental pull-away by a recieving transport unit without the disconnecting the trnsfer hose.  According to the EPA look-up tables, the end point would be .10 miles with an appoximate poplulation of 5 people.  All employees working at this facility have been trained on how to respond to this type of scenario.

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.

We have never had an accident involving NH3 that caused death, injuries, property or enviromental damage or evacuations.

In the event of an emerbency involving out NH3 plant, it is our policy to notify the Buffalo Center Fire Department and request that they respond to the ejmergency. We have discussed this policy withthe fire department and members of the fire department have inspected our NH3 facility.

There are no planned changes of our proceedures or policies.
